abstract: Shearman & Sterling is latest law firm to cull partners by setting their retirement dates or demoting them to salaried status, in process called de-equitizing that cuts them out of yearly profit distribution; reorganization comes after several partners with blue chip clients left firm; legal consultants report percentage of equity partners in top 100 firms is declining due to personal choice or low demand for legal services.

headline.print_headline: Law Firms Cull Partner Ranks in Face of Market Challenges
headline.main: Law Firms, Struggling Financially, Cull Partner Ranks

snippet: The latest to publicly weigh such a step is Shearman & Sterling, which indicated that it would reshape its structure, primarily through demotions....
lead_paragraph: The latest to publicly weigh such a step is Shearman & Sterling, which indicated that it would reshape its structure, primarily through demotions.
